info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, northeastern Rutherford and southwestern Burke Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Marion, or 4 miles south of Lake James State Park, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Lake James State Park, Lake James, Nebo, Thermal City, Glenwood, Sunshine, Fero, Dysartsville and Union Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
